definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: In my vagabond years most derelicts seemed to be white.
sentences.chinese: 在我流浪那些年，大多数被遗弃的男人好像都是白人。

sentences.english: Robert ran out on his young wife.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特遗弃了他年轻的妻子。

sentences.english: They have abandoned their children to the tender mercies of the social services.
sentences.chinese: 他们遗弃了孩子，任其在社会福利中听天由命。

sentences.english: Many of the wristwatches sold at used good markets are unredeemed pledges from pawnshops .
sentences.chinese: 旧货市场的手表，不少是被主人遗弃的流当品。

sentences.english: Abandoned away by her lover, she pined away.
sentences.chinese: 她因遭情人遗弃而日渐憔悴。

sentences.english: But now, any ill-treatment of abandonment is strictly prohibited by the law.
sentences.chinese: 现在，遗弃残疾人被法律严令禁止。

sentences.english: One sweet, now cold, I lost or abandoned by you.
sentences.chinese: 当初旳甜蜜，现在旳冷落，是莪丢失还是妳遗弃。

sentences.english: Hope deserts us at no period of our existence. ----R. l. Stevenson.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的整个一生中，希望从未遗弃我们。

sentences.english: Against the god who had abandoned him all those years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他将找那位父神，一泄多年前遗弃自己的怨怼。

sentences.english: A small country with many foes cannot afford to become a pariah.
sentences.chinese: 有着众多敌人的小国承担不起变成被遗弃贱民的代价。

sentences.english: Lidiya Shulga is the director of a shelter for abandoned children.
sentences.chinese: 沙佳是收容遗弃孩童庇护所的主任。

sentences.english: He was really thrown to the wolves by his teamates.
sentences.chinese: 他真的完全被大家遗弃了。

sentences.english: She is embittered equally by Morris'desertion and her father's cruelty.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯的遗弃和父亲的无情都同样使她痛苦万分。

sentences.english: The Duck remained abandoned and became the talk of local ghost stories.
sentences.chinese: “土鸭子”从此被遗弃了，成为当地鬼故事的一部分。

sentences.english: He was really affected most miserably of all by this desertion.
sentences.chinese: 在所有的事情中，她的遗弃确实让他最为痛苦。

definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to offer shelter/to have sb in one's care
to provide a place to stay/to house/to accommodate/(of an institution etc) to take in/to accept
